title: Mourning Sampler, ca. 1850
medium:
Medium: wool, silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave cotton with paired warps and wefts (Penelope canvas)
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Purchased in Exeter, NH, 1922
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description: Two female angels draped over a tomb with an anchor at the bottom and a leafy tree behind.  Lettering at the bottom reads: GRANDMOTHER

tombstone.epitaph:
Mourning Sampler, ca. 1850.
ca. 1850. Medium: wool, silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave cotton with paired warps and wefts (Penelope canvas). Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1976-100-6.
